intro: Lasianthus yaharae, commonly known as the Yahara lasianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from deep violet to pale blue. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lasianthus yaharae is considered a conservation concern.
